dashboard.description:
# Remote Worker Experience This pack helps you understand the Remote Worker Digital Experience and readiness.
# Understand Application Breakdown This dashboard helps you understand the key applications and their behaviour when it comes to managing Remote Worker experience. The dashboard is split in a left / right fashion allowing you to compare the Remote experience with the Local experience.
**Top Network Traffic [by Application]** -These are the most talkative applications, any unexpectedly high values should be investigated. By comparing to the Office experience on the right this should provide some context in terms of expected values.
**Top Network Response Time** - This is similar to the Network Traffic above, but focusing on the network response time. Slow applications will frustrate your workers.
**Application Crash and Application Freeze Ratio** - The two sections here are covering stability and responsiveness. Crashes are undesired in all circumstances and the Remote Workers should have both low crash and freeze ratio, plus it should not be exceeded the experience for Office workers. Any significant difference in these values (or any high values) should be investigated. Note that the minimum number of devices which must experience an application crash or freeze is 25 over the time period before this metric will log the activity.
::: configuration
The configuration of which workers are remote and which are Office based should be configured. Details of this step can be found at [The Nexthink Documentation Portal](https://doc.nexthink.com/Documentation/Nexthink/latest/LibraryPacksConfiguration/RemoteWorkerExperienceManagement)
**Please contact Nexthink if you would like help with customization of this dashboard.**
:::
dashboard.name: Monitor - Application Usage

metric.label: Top Office Worker Application Total Traffic

tableConfig.title: Top Network Response Time by Application for Remote Workers

metric.label: Remote Worker Experience - Network - Top Remote Worker 100 Application with higher response time

tableConfig.title: Top Network Response Time by Application for Office Workers

metric.label: Remote Worker Experience - Network - Top Office Worker 100 Application by response time

Remote Worker Experience - Network - Top Remote Worker application freezes
Remote Worker Experience - Network - Top Office Worker application freezes

dashboard.description:
# Remote Worker Experience This pack helps you understand the Remote Worker Digital Experience and readiness.
# Understand Remote Landscape This dashboard looks ONLY at remotely connected devices to give a status on how your current remote landscape is configured from a Compliance perspective
**Certificate Overview** - Use this information to isolate any certificate based problems with VPN connectivity.
**OS Build Dispersion** - This table will tell you which build's of OS you have across you're remote worker's devices. Do not to allow users to become too out of date with their OS version as this may ultimately affect the success of their remote working experience.
**Password Expiration** - These KPI's advise if you have users with soon-to-expire passwords, along with the success rate of the actual Remote Action based check. Users should, of course, change their password regularly and the Remote Action can be configured to send a campaign to remind users to do so. A daily check with follow up is recommended for any values on these KPI's.
**Bitlocker Protection** - These KPIâ€™s advise if you have devices with the disk unencrypted, along with the success rate of the Remote Action to retrieve this information. A daily execution of the Remote action is recommended to understand your complaince. If you need to encrypt these disks then there is a [Nexthink Remote Action](https://www.nexthink.com/library/disk-encryption/?searchReturn=bitlocker) that can be enabled to do it.
**VPN and Firewall / AV /Other Version Dispersion** - These two tables give the details of the relevant executables by version. To ensure a smooth remote working experience ensure your employee's are using the software that is of a compliant level for your Organization.
::: configuration
This dashboard requires configuration before use because it uses some Nexthink categories and metric customization. Please visit [The Nexthink Documentation Portal](https://doc.nexthink.com/Documentation/Nexthink/latest/LibraryPacksConfiguration/RemoteWorkerExperienceManagement) to set these before use.
**Please contact Nexthink if you would like help with customization of this dashboard.**
:::
dashboard.name: Monitor - Compliance

metric.label: Remote Worker Experience - Understand Remote Landscape - VPN Top 10 versions deployed
Remote Worker Experience - Understand Remote Landscape - Firewall Top 10 versions deployed

dashboard.description:
# Remote Worker Experience This pack helps you understand the Remote Worker Digital Experience and readiness.
# Understand Connection Usage This dashboard gives insights into how the Remote Workers are using their remote connectivity in terms of the network. Use the measures here to keep a check on your bandwidth utilization with resepct to Remote Workers.
**Remotely Device Landscape** - This dashboard shows how much of your workforce is connected remotely and how much is connected directly from the office. Should you have any policies in place regarding where your employees should be working from this dashboard can be used to understand the current values and trend.
**Remote Worker Network Traffic** - The widgets on this part of the dashboard give an understanding of the current and historial statistics from remote workers regarding network traffic, port usage and network response time. When connected remotely it is important that the remote users have a similar (or better) experience than Office based workers so users using high amounts of network traffic, unexpected high volumes from a particular port, the highest volume users of the remote connections are all items which should be of interest and well understood.
**Remote Worker Web Traffic** - This last section focuses solely on web traffic, in particular, via the category "unwanted domains" you can list domains you prefer Remote Workers not to be visiting. The widgets show the amount of "normal" web traffic along with the unauthorized amounts plus the trend.
::: configuration
The configuration of the unwanted domains, which workers are remote and which are Office based should be configured. Details of this step can be found at [The Nexthink Documentation Portal](https://doc.nexthink.com/Documentation/Nexthink/latest/LibraryPacksConfiguration/RemoteWorkerExperienceManagement)
**Please contact Nexthink if you would like help with customization of this dashboard.**
:::
dashboard.name: Monitor - Connection Usage

metric.label: Remote Worker Experience - Network - Top Traffic by Port
Worker Experience - Network - Top 20 Remote Users by Bandwidth
Remote Worker Experience - Network - Remote Worker average network response time
Remote Worker Experience - Connection Usage - Top x domains by total web traffic
Remote Worker Experience - Connection Usage - Top x unwanted domains by total web traffic

dashboard.description:
# Remote Worker Experience This pack helps you understand the Remote Worker Digital Experience and readiness.
# Monitor - Digital Experience
**Remotely Connected Worker** - The Digital Experience of Remote Workers is of paramount important. The KPI, trend and breakdown measures here will inform you of the current experience. If this is different from the Office Based Workers, there should be an investigation as it is important Remote Workers have the same (or better) experience than those in the office.
**Office Based Workers** - This right side of the dashboard reflects the same Digital Experience measurement and breakdown but for Office based workers, giving the necessary insight to confirm that your Remote Workers are not receiving a degraded experience compared to the Office based ones.
::: configuration
The configuration or which workers are remote and which are Office based should be configured, details of this step can be found at [The Nexthink Documentation Portal](https://doc.nexthink.com/Documentation/Nexthink/latest/LibraryPacksConfiguration/RemoteWorkerExperienceManagement)
**Please contact Nexthink if you would like help with customization of this dashboard.**
:::
dashboard.name: Monitor - Digital Experience

metric.label: Home Office - Monitor - DXS of Home Office Based Workers
Home Office - Monitor - DXS of Office Based Workers

dashboard.description:
# Remote Worker Experience This pack helps you understand the Remote Worker Digital Experience and readiness.
# Monitor - Teams This dashboard gives the entire Microsoft Teams experience. Note this includes both office and remote workers because it is critical all users have a good teams experience if collaboration is going to succeed.
**Teams Deployment** - This shows how many devices are running Microsoft Teams and what percentage of the total systems that is. The definition of Active in this dashboard is devices that have reported in, in the last seven days.
**Teams Digital Experience** - This focuses on the Digital Experience of Microsoft Teams users which is the critical measure for your MS Teams performance.
**Low Successful Web Requests** - This chart looks at Web Requests and their success. Devices or locations with high failed web requests should be investigated as this will impact the Teams experience.
**Version Dispersion** - Visibility on the number of *different* version of Microsoft Teams deployed and this is broken down by to actual values on the right. Teams should retain to current or current minus one version so follow up any below this.
**TopX Devices** - The last are of this dashboard shows the top devices experiencing stability or performance problems, which can then be proactively addressed.
::: configuration No configuration is needed for this dashboard as is.
**Please contact Nexthink if you would like help with customization of this dashboard.** :::
dashboard.name: Monitor - MS Teams

metric.label: Remote Worker Experience - Teams - Top 10 versions deployed
Remote Worker Experience - Teams - Top X Application crashes
Remote Worker Experience - Teams - Top X Application freezes

dashboard.description:
# Remote Worker Experience This pack helps you understand the Remote Worker Digital Experience and readiness. # Monitor - O365 ProPlus This dashboard gives an understanding of your Office 365 ProPlus landscape from a remote worker perspective. Nexthink has an extensive pack on Office 365 ProPlus and if a more in depth view of the landscape is required covering all, not just remote workers, it can be downloaded from the Library [here](https://www.nexthink.com/library/office-365-proplus-operate/?searchReturn=ProPlus).
**Understand remote worker O365 ProPlus patching compliance** â€“ This section shows your progress towards patching your ProPlus landscape to a compliant version for your remote workers. The version that you wish to attain is configured as part of the [ProPlus Required Version](nxt://Edit-NxCategory?Encoding=Url&Name=ProPlus%20Required%20Version&Type=package) category and the [ProPlus Version](nxt://Edit-NxCategory?Encoding=Url&Name=ProPlus%20Version&Type=package) category. For more information on these categories please see the [Remote Worker documentation](https://doc.nexthink.com/Documentation/Nexthink/latest/LibraryPacksConfiguration/RemoteWorkerExperienceManagement).
**Understand O365 ProPlus performance** â€“ This section shows the productivity DEX score of remote workers with the required ProPlus version and how they are performing relative to those without the required version.
**Understand O365 ProPlus versioning landscape** â€“ This section shows you an overview of your ProPlus landscape. You can see the various versions of ProPlus that are deployed on remote worker machines.
::: configuration This dashboard requires configuration. * Verify that the [ProPlus Required Version](nxt://Edit-NxCategory?Encoding=Url&Name=ProPlus%20Required%20Version&Type=package) category has been configured. * Verify that the [ProPlus Version](nxt://Edit-NxCategory?Encoding=Url&Name=ProPlus%20Version&Type=package) category has been configured. * Ensure that [Remote Worker Experience](https://doc.nexthink.com/Documentation/Nexthink/latest/LibraryPacksConfiguration/RemoteWorkerExperienceManagement) documentation has been followed.
Please contact Nexthink Professional Services if you would like help with the configuration or customization of this dashboard. :::
dashboard.name: Monitor - O365 ProPlus

titleConfig.title: Understand remote worker O365 ProPlus patching compliance

titleConfig.title: Understand remote worker O365 ProPlus performance landscape

dashboard.description:
# Remote Worker Experience This pack helps you understand the Remote Worker Digital Experience and readiness.
# Monitor - Skype for Business This dashboard gives the entire Skype for Business experience. Note this includes both office and remote workers because it is critical all users have a good teams experience if collaboration is going to succeed. Note that this dashboard measures an active Skype device as one that has reported in during the last seven days AND has executed lync.exe (the SfB executable) at least once.
**Skype Crash and Freeze Ratio** - this chart focuses on the stability of Skype for Business for stability issues such as crashing and freezing.
**Version Disparity** - Visibility on the number of *different* version of Skype for Business deployed and this is broken down by to actual values on the right. Low versions of Skype for Business should be addressed.
**TopX Stability** - The lower level of the dashboard focuses on stability of Skype for Business and lists the key devices with stability issues such as crashing and freezing or high web request duration.
::: configuration No configuration is needed for this dashboard as is.
**Please contact Nexthink if you would like help with customization of this dashboard.** :::
dashboard.name: Monitor - Skype for Business

lineChartConfig.title: Skype Crash ratio and Freeze ratio

metric.label: Remote Worker Experience - Skype for Business - Top 10 versions deployed
Remote Worker Experience - Skype for Business - Top X Application crashes
Remote Worker Experience - Skype for Business - Top X Application freezes

dashboard.description:
# Remote Worker Experience This pack helps you understand your remote worker digital experience and readiness.
--- # Remote WiFi experience This dashboard reflects the user experience with WiFi outside the corporate connection. The strength of the WiFi signal in the network coverage area has a direct impact on the user experience and the ability to perform various activities. Several factors can impact WiFi signal strength: * **Router location :** The height of the router, central location, interference from other devices such as walls and floors can be some of the reasons that can impact it's ability to deliver a good signal throughout your intended coverage area. * **Distance from the Router :** Devices that require strong signals such as those that will be used for video conferencing or streaming may obtain better performance by being located close to the router. In some cases, the signal can be enhanced by employing additional equipment such as signal boosters to extend the WiFiâ€™s range. * **Router updates :** It is recommended to update routers to keep it operating at maximum efficiency. It is also recommended to periodically restart routers to automatically apply the firmware provided by ISP. # Understanding Wifi Strength Effect on Digital Experience. By comparing Digital Experience on devices that have a good or bad signal, allows you to compare if bad Wifi connections impact user experience. # Wifi strength The background noise levels that can affect your WiFi performance are expressed in dBms. ::: tip **Between -30 dBm and -67 dBm**, the signal will be sufficient for Remote Worker activities.
**At -70 dBm**, this level is the minimum signal strength required to ensure reliable packet delivery and will allow you to surf the web and exchange emails.
**Under -80 dBm**, the signal strength is bad and the end user experience will be impacted by network issues and disconnections. ::: # Feedback of Campaign Usefulness In order to educate your users, a campaign is launched at the level defined in the remote action in order to inform your users of a bad signal. The user can then report to you if the campaign has benefited him through one of the survey responses. You can deactivate the campaign by setting the parameter to -100 in the **Get Wi-Fi Signal Strength** remote action. **The deactivation of the campaign will have an impact on the visualization of this dashboard.** ::: configuration * In order to differentiate corporate connections from other connections, please configure the **Get Wi-Fi Signal Strength** remote action, please consult [The Nexthink Documentation Portal](https://doc.nexthink.com/Documentation/Nexthink/latest/LibraryPacksConfiguration/RemoteWorkerExperienceManagement) * In order to educate your users with an adapted campaign and in order to optimize the level of campaign triggering, please consult [The Nexthink Documentation Portal](https://doc.nexthink.com/Documentation/Nexthink/latest/LibraryPacksConfiguration/RemoteWorkerExperienceManagement)
**Please contact Nexthink if you would like help with customization of this dashboard.** :::
dashboard.name: Monitor - Wifi Connection

titleConfig.title: Understanding Wifi Strength Effect on Digital Experience Score
Wifi Strength Details and Feedback of Campaign Usefulness

metric.label: Num Employees who found Wifi Campaign Useful
Num Devices With Poor Wifi Strength

dashboard.description:
# Remote Worker Experience This pack helps you understand the Remote Worker Digital Experience and readiness.
# Monitor - Zoom This dashboard gives the entire Zoom experience. Note this includes both office and remote workers because it is critical all users have a good teams experience if collaboration is going to succeed. Note that this dashboard measures an active Zoom device as one that has reported in during the last seven days.
**Zoom Crash and Freeze Ratio** - this chart focuses on the stability of Zoom for stability issues such as crashing and freezing.
**Version Disparity** - Visibility on the number of *different* version of Zoom deployed and this is broken down by to actual values on the right. Low versions of Zoom should be addressed.
**TopX Stability** - The lower level of the dashboard focuses on stability of Zoom and lists the key devices with stability issues such as crashing and freezing or high web request duration.
::: configuration No configuration is needed for this dashboard as is.
**Please contact Nexthink if you would like help with customization of this dashboard.** :::

dashboard.description:
# Remote Worker Experience This pack helps you understand the Remote Worker Digital Experience and readiness.
# Readiness Assessment The Readiness Assessment dashboard looks at ALL (not just remote) devices to help IT understand whether they are ready for using as a remote work device.
**Summary** - These widgets are informing you whether you are currently in a state where your employees will be able to work remotely. This is based upon the configuration of their devices and they will be only deemed ready when they are at a necessary compliance level. It also includes both the trend over time and regional breakdown of this data.
**Readiness Details** - This section of the dashboard focuses on the individual items themselves, giving a clear breakdown of which components are ready (indicating the software component is installed) and which are not. The Readiness Details covers the Collaboration Tools, Firewall and VPN components This can be used by support teams as a proactive tracker to ensure they are fully prepared for when an employee wishes to work remotely.
**Security Readiness** - This continues the Readiness assessment but from a security perspective, looking at whether there is a valid certificate for remote access and whether the device is Bitlocker enabled. This can be used by support teams as a proactive tracker to ensure they are fully prepared for when an employee wishes to work remotely.
::: configuration
This dashboard requires configuration before use because it uses some Nexthink Categories, Remote Actions and Metric customization. Please visit [The Nexthink Documentation Portal](https://doc.nexthink.com/Documentation/Nexthink/latest/LibraryPacksConfiguration/RemoteWorkerExperienceManagement) to set these before use.
**Please contact Nexthink if you would like help with customization of this dashboard.**
:::
Version 5.0.0.1
dashboard.name: Readiness - Assessment

dashboard.description:
# Remote Worker Experience This pack helps you understand your remote worker digital experience and readiness.
# Employee Sentiment This dashboard reflects the user sentiment with regards to their remote working experience. While technical data is vital the picture is not complete without human sentiment, which may reveal important topics that must be focused on as a priority.
**Satisfaction** - This KPI is a response to simply asking the user their satisfaction when working remotely. Should the users be responding negatively then this should be investigated as unhappy users will be less productive. There follows a breakdown of this data by location.
**Productivity** - This critical KPI gives a binary response as to whether the user is able to work remotely from their perspective regardless of the technical data being reported. Any employees who respond they are not able to work, who will show in this KPI should be addressed as a priority.
**Current Remote Worker Issues** - These bar charts will highlight any areas that are negatively impacting your users, in regards to their current remote work experience. This data should be acted on as it is directly impacting your employee's productivity overall.
::: configuration As with all Nexthink user sentiment data, the correct campaigns must have been sent out. For details on configuring this please see [The Nexthink Documentation Portal](https://doc.nexthink.com/Documentation/Nexthink/latest/LibraryPacksConfiguration/RemoteWorkerExperienceManagement)
**Please contact Nexthink if you would like help with customization of this dashboard.** :::
dashboard.name: Sentiment - Satisfaction

metric.label: Remote Worker Experience - Sentiment - Satisfaction breakdown
Employees not able to work remotely
Users not able to work remotely

dashboard.description:
# Remote Worker Experience This pack helps you understand your remote worker digital experience and readiness.
**Employee Well-being** This dashboard reflects the employee sentiment overall wellness while working remotely, from a human rather than just an IT perspective. This should be used to understand if there are areas that you can improve on to give your employees a better remote working experience.
**Well-being Score** - The well-being score is a summary of all the questions posed in the Engage campaign for Employee wellness. This score should be sufficiently high and should not be following a downward trend. A low score reflects dissatisfaction from your Employees which should be of concern.
**Drilldowns** - The lower section of the dashboard gives you the results of the Engage campaign broken down by the responses to the individual questions, which covers remote satisfaction, stress, workload expectations, perceived productivity, organizational support.
::: configuration As with all Nexthink user sentiment data, the correct campaigns must have been sent out. For details on configuring this please see [The Nexthink Documentation Portal](https://doc.nexthink.com/Documentation/Nexthink/latest/LibraryPacksConfiguration/RemoteWorkerExperienceManagement)
**Please contact Nexthink if you would like help with customization of this dashboard.** :::
dashboard.name: Sentiment - Well-being

metric.label: Remote Worker Experience - Well-being - Remote satisfaction answers
Remote Worker Experience - Well-being - Stress answers
Remote Worker Experience - Well-being - Workload expectations answers
Remote Worker Experience - Well-being - Perceived productivity answers
Remote Worker Experience - Well-being - Support from organization answers
